description:
Be a Change Maker: Join the Anglican Diocese of Ottawa! We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Donor and Fundraising Coordinator to join our team. This role is pivotal in establishing and nurturing relationships with donors, identifying funding opportunities, and developing strategies to ensure sustainable funding.
Key Responsibilities
Donor Management: Develop and implement strategies for donor acquisition, retention, and appreciation.Manage and update donor database, ensuring accurate record-keeping of donations and communications.
Fundraising Strategy:Create and execute innovative fundraising strategies to meet and exceed revenue targets.Organize and coordinate fundraising events and campaigns.
Communication and Reporting:Develop communication materials for donors, including newsletters, email updates, and impact reports.Ensure timely and accurate reporting on fundraising activities and donor management.
Grant Writing and Management:Identify, apply, and manage grant opportunities, ensuring compliance with guidelines and reporting requirements.
Volunteer Coordination:Assist in recruiting and managing volunteers for fundraising events and activities.
Budget Management:Monitor and manage the fundraising budget, ensuring effective use of resources.
Community Engagement:Represent the organization in community events and forums to build visibility and support.
Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Nonprofit Management, or a related field.
 A minimum of 3 years of experience in fundraising and donor management.
 Proven track record of developing and executing successful fundraising strategies.
 Proficiency in Raiser’s Edge or similar CRM software for fund development management.
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
 Strong organizational and event management skills.
 Ability to work flexibly in a team and independently.

Perks & Benefits: We Value You
Beyond a competitive salary, we offer comprehensive healthcare and dental coverage, and a defined benefit pension plan with generous employer contribution. We honour work-life balance with a generous compensation package that includes a 35-hour workweek and 3 weeks of vacation to start with.
Don't just apply for a job, apply for a cause! Click on "Apply for This Position" and submit your application. We'll be reviewing applications as they come in, so don't delay!
While all applications will be gratefully received, only individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted. The Anglican Diocese of Ottawa reserves the right to contact individuals and to arrange for interviews at any time.
Our organization is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, veteran status, or disability. We will accommodate the needs of applicants under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please advise during the search process if you require accommodation by contacting us at hr@ottawa.anglican.ca
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $32.00-$34.00 per hour
Expected hours: 35 per week
Benefits:

 Company pension
 Dental care
 Employee assistance program
 Extended health care
 Life insurance

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
